page.title: 14 ANDREWS AIRFIELD
page.content: Andrews Airfield used to be an American Air Base in the second world war. It was named after Lieutenant General Frank Andrews who was killed in the war. The Airfield was closed at the end of the war in 1945 and turned back into farmland. In 1972 a group of enthusiasts formed Andrewsfield Flying Club. Now the club has 200 members although not all of them fly. There are about 30 planes there, 9 of which are club planes. To help run the club there is a trained engineer, office workers and 3 full time flying instructors. The planes they normally use for lessons are Cessna 180s. Lessons cost Â£40 an hour and it normally takes 40 hours to learn to fly. Before you can get your pilots licence you have to pass four written exams.
